newsitem.title: UK: British Steel eases after currency warning.
newsitem.headline: British Steel eases after currency warning.

text.p: Shares in British Steel Plc retreated after the company warned again on stronger sterling's effect on business.
The stock fell 1-1/4p to 155-1/2p having hit 159p earlier in a robust overall market.
"They've highlighted the fact that sterling has gone up 20 pfennigs since they said it was unrealistically high when their figures came out," said one analyst.
On June 16 British Steel revealed full-year profits almost halved by sterling's rise together with weaker steel prices.
Last week British Steel bought back five percent, or 93.234 million, of its shares at 155p per share.
"What do you do when you've bought back five percent of your shares and your share price doesn't go up?" said the analyst.
